smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function showDialog appears to be too complex.
The function migrate appears to be too complex.
The function setConnectionParameters appears to be too complex.
The function getType appears to be too complex.
The function resolveVariables appears to be too complex.
The function perform appears to be too complex.
The function findPattern appears to be too complex.
The function onCreate appears to be too complex.
The function onActivityResult appears to be too complex.
The function migrate appears to be too complex.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function migrate is nested too deeply.
Function createLauncherShortcuts is nested too deeply.
Function parseGzippedByteArray is nested too deeply.
Function perform is nested too deeply.
Function onActivityResult is nested too deeply.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

instances.message: The function performRequest is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function initViews is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function duplicate is too long. The maximum length is 20.

smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

instances.message: The function perform has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.
The function performBlocking has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.

smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

instances.message: This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.

smells.name: UnnecessaryAbstractClass
smells.description: An abstract class is unnecessary and can be refactored. An abstract class should have both abstract and concrete properties or functions. An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface. An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

instances.message: An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.
An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.

instances.message: The class Settings defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class ThemeHelper defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class VariablePlaceholder defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class Replacement defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in ((findMax(variable) - findMin(variable)) / findStep(variable)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: (findMax(variable) - findMin(variable)) / findStep(variable)
Parentheses in (internalData[KEY_PATTERN]?.toIntOrNull()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: internalData[KEY_PATTERN]?.toIntOrNull()
Parentheses in (internalData[KEY_WAIT_FOR_COMPLETION]?.toBoolean()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: internalData[KEY_WAIT_FOR_COMPLETION]?.toBoolean()
Parentheses in (tryNumber == 1 && shortcut.delay > 0) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: tryNumber == 1 && shortcut.delay > 0
Parentheses in (intent.getSerializableExtra(EXTRA_CURL_COMMAND) as? CurlCommand) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: intent.getSerializableExtra(EXTRA_CURL_COMMAND) as? CurlCommand

smells.name: ReturnCount
smells.description: Restrict the number of return statements in methods.

instances.message: Function resolve has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function perform has 6 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function perform has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function validate has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function isSameAs has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function isSameAs has 4 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function moveShortcut has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.

smells.name: ForbiddenComment
smells.description: Flags a forbidden comment. Defaults values are TODO:, FIXME: or STOPSHIP:
